trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control renders HTML `table` elements and inline styles, or `listitem` elements and cascading style sheet (CSS) styles.

You use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuRenderingMode> enumeration when you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.RenderingMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.
The value that you assign to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.RenderingMode%2A> property determines how the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control renders markup.
In ASP.NET 3.5 and earlier versions, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control uses HTML `table` elements and inline styles to control the appearance of the menu in a browser.
In ASP.NET 4 and later versions, by default the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control uses `listitem` elements and cascading style sheet (CSS) styles.
This enumeration is provided for backward compatibility.
In ASP.NET 4 and later versions, you can use this enumeration to specify that you want the menu control to generate markup the way it does in earlier versions of ASP.NET.

The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control renders markup in the way it does by default for the version of ASP.NET indicated by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.RenderingCompatibility"></xref> property of the control.
If the value of the property is 3.5, this setting is equivalent to .
If the value of the property is 4.0 or greater, this setting is equivalent to .
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control renders markup by using list item (`li`) elements and CSS styles.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control renders markup by using `table` elements and inline styles.
